alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Henry; Shelby (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 7:34PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of EAST CENTRAL Kentucky and NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in EAST CENTRAL Kentucky, Franklin. In NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Henry and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 732 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to continuous slow-moving thunderstorms over the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. The Kentucky Mesonet site in northern Shelby County reported over 2 inches of rain had fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shelbyville, Eminence, Pleasureville, Elmburg, Defoe, North Pleasureville, Cropper, Bethlehem, Old Christianburg and Bellview. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
